title: What to Do in a Crisis

blocks.text: This chapter provides guidance on how to handle mental health crises and interact with emergency services.

A mental health crisis is any situation in which a person's behavior puts them at risk of hurting themselves or others and/or prevents them from being able to care for themselves or function effectively in the community.
Warning signs that may indicate an impending crisis include increased agitation, non-compliance with treatment, isolation, and substance use.

sections.title: Basic steps to take when your loved one is in a crisis

blocks.text: During a crisis, it's important to remain calm, assess the situation for immediate danger, and contact appropriate help, which may include emergency services or crisis hotlines.

When interacting with police during a mental health crisis, it's crucial to clearly communicate that the situation involves a mental health condition and provide relevant information about the person's diagnosis and current state.
